scenes.background: You are on annual leave, enjoying some well-deserved time off to recharge. However, during your time away, a colleague messages you privately, saying there’s an urgent task that needs immediate attention. The request creates a dilemma as you try to balance respecting your time off while feeling the pressure to help with the urgent task. You chose to take a quick look and help out. After some time, [Monica] and [Bob] approach you in the cafeteria. [Monica] looks slightly concerned while [Bob] seems indifferent. You expressed understanding of Monica's concerns and acknowledged you should have set clearer boundaries.
scenes.description: [Bob] chimes in, 'Honestly, [Alex], I think it’s a bit over the top to worry about setting boundaries. We all need to pitch in when things get tough. Don’t you agree?'

options.text: I see where you're coming from, but I think it's important to find a balance.
options.analysis: You acknowledge Bob's point while emphasizing the need for balance, showing good self-regulation and social skills.

options.text: Maybe you're right, Bob. Sometimes we need to make sacrifices for the team.
options.analysis: You agree with Bob's perspective, demonstrating empathy and emotional perception but lower social skills.

options.text: If everyone pitches in all the time, we won't have any personal life left.
options.analysis: You express concern for personal boundaries, showing strong motivation but lower empathy and social skills.
